text: Psalm 90
God’s Eternity and Human Frailty
A prayer of Moses, the man of God.\f + \fr Ps 90 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
O Lord, you have been our help\f + \fr 90:1 \ft Or “dwelling place” \f* ⸤in all generations⸥.\f + \fr 90:1 \ft Literally “in a generation and a generation” \f*
Before \add the\add* mountains were born
and you brought forth \add the\add* earth and \add the\add* world,
even from everlasting to everlasting, you \add are\add* God.
You return man to \add the\add* dust,
⸤saying⸥,\f + \fr 90:3 \ft Literally “and you say” \f* “Return, O sons of man.”
For a thousand years in your eyes
\add are\add* like yesterday when it passes,
or \add like\add* a watch in the night.
You sweep them away \add like a flood\add*.
They fall asleep.\f + \fr 90:5 \ft The interpretation of 5a is difficult \f*
In the morning \add they are\add* like grass \add that\add* sprouts anew.
In the morning it blossoms and sprouts anew;
by evening it withers and dries up.
For we are brought to an end by your anger,
and we hasten \add off\add*\f + \fr 90:7 \ft Or “we are terrified” \f* by your wrath.
You have put our iniquities before you,
our hidden \add sins\add* into the light of your countenance.
For all of our days dwindle away in your rage;
we complete our years like a sigh.
As for the days of our years, within them \add are\add* seventy years
or if by strength eighty years, and their pride\f + \fr 90:10 \ft Or “span” \f* \add is\add* trouble and disaster,
for it passes quickly and we fly \add away\add*.
Who knows the strength of your anger,
and your rage consistent with\f + \fr 90:11 \ft Hebrew “according to” \f* \add the\add* fear due you?
So teach \add us\add* to number our days
that we may gain a heart of wisdom.
Return,\f + \fr 90:13 \ft Or “Turn back \fq your wrath \ft ” \f* O Yahweh. How long?
And have compassion on\f + \fr 90:13 \ft Or “change your mind concerning” \f* your servants.
Satisfy us in the morning with your loyal love,
that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us,
\add for as many\add* years \add as\add* we have seen calamity.
Let your work be visible to your servants,
and your majesty to their children.
And let the beauty of the Lord our God be upon us,
and establish for us the work of our hands,
yes, the work of our hands, establish it.
